result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Antonio M. Daniels was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:12 p.m. Defendant Antonio M. Daniels in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm10, 16cm 80, 16tr431, 16tr424. Schiek states agreement. State moves to dismiss Counts 1 and 3 in 16cm80 - Granted. State moves to dismiss 16cm10 and 16tr424 - Granted. In 16tr431 - Stipulation of refusal is deemed reasonable. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea. Schiek/Ferguson/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 2 years
Jail - 45 days; all but 14 days stayed with successful completion of OWI treatment court. With Huber for all purposes. To commence on/before Friday, August 12, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. 
Fine - $1744 plus IID Surcharge and Blood Draw Surcharge
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Driver's license revoked - 24 months
IID - 12 months
Driver's Safety Plan
AODA Assessment and follow - through
Jail credit - 1 day if revoked
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 3:30 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Ferguson states she has received some discovery - requests adjournment. Bail continued. Adj. 1:43 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

1:55 p.m. Defendant Antonio M. Daniels in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 16cm80 and 16tr424. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea. Ferguson motion to move to Branch 2 for judicial economy - Granted.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
